result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony S. Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 18 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a High School Equivalency Diploma (HSED) during the pendency of probation term.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
No DNA sample and/or surcharge is assessed as Defendant previously provided the same through another felony conviction.

timeConds.notes: Time Served Sentence with credit for 56 days of prior time served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony S. Adams

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:50 PM: Defendant Anthony S. Adams in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  It is believed that Def will decline probation offer on resolution.  Argues for 5 mos WCJ.  Based upon review of statutory requirements, State does not believe Def would be entitled to expungement.  Counsel expect to argue terms of sentencing.  Def and counsel confirm State's recital.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Court reviews s. 973.01(5m)(a)(3b) and confirms Def would not be eligible for any expungement.  Def and counsel agree with Court's interpretation.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Repeater Component dismissed by the Court.  Argument by DA.  Argues for direct jail sentence for 5 mos or 150 days.  Argument by Atty Rashid - argues for Court to accept State's recommendation of 5 mos WCJ.  Should be awarded 56 days of TS credit.  Will no longer argue for expungement.  Def requests 45 days to report.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  Supervision terminated on 5/4/2015.   Further statement by Def as to why supervision is being declined.  The Court:  Recognizes Def's progress made to date.  Imposes:   8 mos WCJ - I/S - S/W - 2 yrs probation - Conditions:  56 days time served sentence in WCJ - Conditions of Supervision:  Ab Sobriety, Bar Prohibition,  and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, obtain HSED, Court Costs plus Buy Money of $60.00; It is assumed that DNA Sample already provided - It is confirmed that DNA sample already provided.  Appeal Rights Given.  Def may petition for termination of supervision at any time after completion of 18 mos, provided joined by agent.   If Def should move, supervision would be transferred to home county.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney David C. Rashid in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Rashid - matter resolved.  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Case called @ 2:37 p.m. Defendant Anthony S. Adams in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court finds probable cause as to each count alleged in the criminal complaint.  Defendant bound over for trial.  Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG Plea entered.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 02:05 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:57 p.m. Defendant Anthony S. Adams in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Defendant Anthony S. Adams in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Preliminary Hearing Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Probation sanction will end on or about May 15th.

Case Called @ 1:09 PM: Defendant Anthony S. Adams in court, in custody, appearing pro se.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has provided information that he will be appointed counsel thru SPD office.  COC was advised of same information.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  DA serves a copy of Complaint on Def personally - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  DA argues for $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No statement by Def as to bond.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
